description_txt: stated on February 14, 2016 in a Republican debate in South Carolina:
quote_txt: Says Jeb Bush "said he would take his pants off and moon everybody ... Nobody reports that."

description_txt: stated on February 13, 2016 in a debate in Greenville, S.C.:
quote_txt: "It has been over 80 years since a lame-duck president appointed a Supreme Court justice."

description_txt: stated on February 13, 2016 in a GOP debate on CBS:
quote_txt: Says "Joseph Stalin said if you want to bring America down you, have to undermine three things: our spiritual life, our patriotism and our morality."

description_txt: stated on January 26, 2016 in testimony at General Assembly :
quote_txt: "In New England, Rhode Island has the second highest number of police officers being assaulted."

description_txt: stated on February 13, 2016 in a Republican presidential debate:

description_txt: stated on February 10, 2016 in in a post on Facebook:
quote_txt: Quotes Mark Cuban as saying, "I worry that millions of millennials are voting Democrat this year because they fact-check everything."

description_txt: stated on January 21, 2016 in a Hillary for America campaign ad:
quote_txt: "On average it takes 300 Americans working for a solid year to make as much money as one top CEO."

description_txt: stated on January 28, 2016 in a campaign ad:
quote_txt: "Kasich’s budget raised taxes by billions, hitting businesses hard and the middle class even harder."

description_txt: stated on February 10, 2016 in a TV ad:

description_txt: stated on February 9, 2016 in his budget proposal address:

description_txt: stated on February 11, 2016 in comments during the PBS Democratic debate:

description_txt: stated on February 11, 2016 in comments during the PBS Democratic debate:
quote_txt: Says Sen. Bernie Sanders has called President Barack Obama "weak. He's called him a disappointment."

description_txt: stated on February 11, 2016 in comments during the PBS Democratic debate:

quote_txt: "Americans haven’t had a raise in 15 years."

description_txt: stated on February 11, 2016 in a PBS Democratic debate:

description_txt: stated on February 9, 2016 in a victory speech after the New Hampshire primary:
quote_txt: "Don't believe those phony numbers when you hear 4.9 and 5 percent unemployment. The number's probably 28, 29, as high as 35. In fact, I even heard recently 42 percent."

description_txt: stated on February 3, 2016 in a commercial:
quote_txt: The Seminole gambling compact offers "$3 billion in guaranteed revenue, the largest share for any state in history."

description_txt: stated on July 30, 2015 in an article on the Frontpage website:
quote_txt: "Obama spent $7 billion to bring electricity to Africa, failed miserably."

description_txt: stated on February 4, 2016 in a debate:
quote_txt: "We bailed out" Johnson Controls when "we saved the auto industry" and "now they want to avoid paying taxes."

description_txt: stated on January 24, 2016 in a post on Medium:
quote_txt: "My two appointments to the Florida Supreme Court, Raul Cantero and Kenneth Bell, have earned reputations as its most consistent conservatives."

description_txt: stated on February 1, 2016 in a campaign rally in Iowa:
quote_txt: "I'm self-funding my own campaign."

description_txt: stated on January 8, 2016 in a 90-page manifesto decrying federal overreach:
quote_txt: "While states used to have regulatory power over fishing, federal law now regulates down to the tenth of the inch the minimum size of fish that anglers can keep."

description_txt: stated on February 6, 2016 in the GOP primary debate in New Hampshire:

description_txt: stated on January 26, 2016 in comments at the University of Iowa:
quote_txt: "We’re spending tremendous amounts of money to educate our kids. In the world, we're No. 1 per pupil by a factor of four."

description_txt: stated on February 6, 2016 in an interview:

description_txt: stated on February 4, 2016 in a Democratic debate in New Hampshire:
